Package moulton.scalable.geometrics

Class Polygon

  • java.lang.Object
    • moulton.scalable.utils.MenuComponent
      • moulton.scalable.geometrics.Polygon
  • public class Polygon
extends MenuComponent
    A aesthetic menu component in a polygonal shape determined by xs and ys. The fill color of the shape is determined by fillColor and the outline color is determined by outlineColor. If not desired, each can be set to null color.
    Author:
    Matthew Moulton
    See Also:
    ShapeResources, Line

    • Field Detail

      • fillColor

        protected java.awt.Color fillColor
        The fill color for the shape. If fill color is null, no fill will be used.
        See Also:
        setFillColor(Color), getFillColor()

      • outlineColor

        protected java.awt.Color outlineColor
        The outline color for the shape. Defaults to null. If null, no outline will be used.
        See Also:
        setOutline(Color), getOutlineColor()

      • xs

        protected java.lang.String[] xs
        Expressions that determine the shape of the component. Should be written in a way that can be solved by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int) at runtime.

      • ys

        protected java.lang.String[] ys
        Expressions that determine the shape of the component. Should be written in a way that can be solved by MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int) at runtime.

      • numberOfPoints

        protected int numberOfPoints
        Internal variable for the number of points in the shape. Results to the minimum length of xs and ys.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Polygon

        public Polygon​(Panel parent,
               int x,
               int y,
               java.lang.String[] xs,
               java.lang.String[] ys,
               java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Creates a polygon and sets in on the grid of the parent panel.
        Parameters:
        parent - the panel to be drawn on to
        x - the x-coordinate on the parent grid
        y - the y-coordinate on the parent grid
        xs - string expressions to represent the x locations for each point in the alloted space
        ys - string expressions to represent the y locations for each point in the alloted space
        fillColor - the color that the polygon is filled in with. The polygon can also have an outline, dictated by outlineColor and set by setOutline(Color).

      • Polygon

        public Polygon​(Panel parent,
               java.lang.String[] xs,
               java.lang.String[] ys,
               java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Creates a polygon to be drawn onto the parent panel
        Parameters:
        parent - the panel to be drawn on
        xs - string expressions to represent the x locations for each point in the alloted space
        ys - string expressions to represent the y locations for each point in the alloted space
        fillColor - the color that the polygon is filled in with. The polygon can also have an outline, dictated by outlineColor and set by setOutline(Color).

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render​(java.awt.Graphics g,
                   int xx,
                   int yy,
                   int ww,
                   int hh)
        Description copied from class: MenuComponent
        Draws on the graphics object to represent this component visually. When this method is called, the type of panel storing (grid or free) has been taken into account and the dimensions of the space given to this component have been calculated using MenuComponent.solveString(String, int, int).
        Specified by:
        render in class MenuComponent
        Parameters:
        g - the graphics object to draw on
        xx - the x-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        yy - the y-position on the graphics image that this component's alloted space begins
        ww - the width on the graphics image that this component is given
        hh - the height on the graphics image this component is given

      • setOutline

        public void setOutline​(java.awt.Color outlineColor)
        Sets the outline color for this polygon. If no outline color is set, or if it is set to null, no outline will be drawn.
        Parameters:
        outlineColor - the color for the outlineColor

      • getOutlineColor

        public java.awt.Color getOutlineColor()
        Returns the outline color for the polygon.
        Returns:
        outlineColor

      • setFillColor

        public void setFillColor​(java.awt.Color fillColor)
        Sets the fill color for the polygon.
        Parameters:
        fillColor - the new color saved as fillColor

      • getFillColor

        public java.awt.Color getFillColor()
        Returns the fill color for the polygon.
        Returns:
        fillColor
